body_html: A warning would be greatly appreciated. I've spent hours debugging my code to finally figure out the issue. It's a common practise to use something like correct_predictions = torch.eq(predictions, targets).sum() and to find out that correct_predictions is always going to be less than 255 isn't intuitive.
body_text: A warning would be greatly appreciated. I've spent hours debugging my code to finally figure out the issue. It's a common practise to use something like correct_predictions = torch.eq(predictions, targets).sum() and to find out that correct_predictions is always going to be less than 255 isn't intuitive.
body: A warning would be greatly appreciated. I've spent hours debugging my code to finally figure out the issue. It's a common practise to use something like `correct_predictions = torch.eq(predictions, targets).sum()` and to find out that `correct_predictions` is always going to be less than 255 isn't intuitive.
